alert.note: Alert for Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 23 at 2:13AM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, ground blizzard conditions possible. Winds could gust as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...The foothills and plains adjacent to the Rocky Mountain Front, and Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 AM this morning to 11 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday afternoon through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, while drifting snow could lead to partial or complete lane blockages.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible ground blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains
